item.title: Fixing FreeBSD kernel panic with UHK keyboard
item.description: I’ve been using FreeBSD on and off as my desktop OS for a couple months (after ~5 years on OSX/macOS). Overall, I like the simplicity and design of the system. However, there’s been a non-trivial amount of hacking and debugging to get some things working. Most recently I discovered that my new UHK keyboard causes a kernel panic when booting. Early in the boot process I was greeted with the following message (stack addresses omitted).
